p: Indeed, our study corroborates other authorsâ€™ findings [ 12, 52, 53] suggesting that the increase of temperature and humidity, due to the global warming prospected to occur during the 21st century, will affect the distribution of Leishmania vectors. As suggested by previous studies [ 12] phlebotomine sand flies are prospected to invade extra-Mediterranean regions especially western and central Europe. Concurrently, Leishmania vectors will lose areas for suitable conditions in North Africa and Middle East. These changes in their geographical distribution are more intense under the A2a scenario than the B2a. Similar projections for the distribution of P. papatasi, P. ariasi and P. sergenti were reported by Trajer et al. [ 54]. Nevertheless, these authors focused their study only on the distribution of phlebotomine species in Europe, since no presence records in North Africa and Middle East were included.
